page.title: 11Gamekeepering at Chatsworth
page.content:
The gamekeeper's year begins in February when the hen pheasants are caught up and penned at the rate of seven hens to one cock. The eggs are taken and set in incubators, hatched and reared to six weeks of age. Then released into the woods in release pens holding from 500-2000 birds depending on the size of the pen.
The shooting at Chatsworth starts mid-November and finishes 1st.February About half of the birds released are shot. Vermin are trapped and shot all year round. There are also Red and Fallow Deer on the estate which are culled annually and sold through the Farm Shop along with the Game. Chatsworth employs seven keepers at the present time.
